Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Portal Vein Embolization Techniques

Participants.evidence: patients eligible for major hepatectomy and requiring FLR optimization

Intervention.evidence: PVE using either NBCA with iodized oil or PVA particles with coils

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the efficacy of different embolic materials in portal vein embolization

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the degree of FLR hypertrophy at 28 days post-PVE

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 100 patients were randomised, with 50 in each group

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on 48 patients in the NBCA group and 47 in the PVA group using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: The NBCA group showed significantly greater FLR hypertrophy (57% vs. 37%, p < 0.01)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were reported in 2/48 (4%) of the NBCA group and 3/47 (6%) of the PVA group

Funding.evidence: This trial was funded by the National Institute of Health
